Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Health and the Subcommittee on Senior Centers

Items.Title: Oversight: New York City's Response to the Flu Vaccine Shortage and its Planned Response to Possible Increased Cases of the Flu.
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight: New York City's Response to the Flu Vaccine Shortage and its Planned Response to Possible Increased Cases of the Flu.

Items.Title: Jointly with the Committee on Health and the Subcommittee on Senior Centers

Resolution calling upon the Congress of the United States to pass S.2968, the “Emergency Flu Response Act of 2004”, introduced on October 8, 2004, by a bipartisan group of Senators, which would address the crisis created by the current shortage of flu vaccine.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.Title: Oversight: New York City's Response to the Flu Vaccine Shortage and its Planned Response to Possible Increased Cases of the Flu.
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Filed, by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight: New York City's Response to the Flu Vaccine Shortage and its Planned Response to Possible Increased Cases of the Flu.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Congress of the United States to pass S.2968, the “Emergency Flu Response Act of 2004”, introduced on October 8, 2004, by a bipartisan group of Senators, which would address the crisis created by the current shortage of flu vaccine.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Approved by Committee

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Speaker Miller, Quinn, Oddo, Sears and Reed
